page.title: 01Old Warden
page.content: The village of Old Warden is about 7 miles S.E. of Bedford,located close to the communication networks of the A1 and M1. Old Warden first originated from the name Weard-dun (watch hill) with the word 'Old' appearing just before 1500.Today it remains one of the most picturesque villages in Bedfordshire attracting many summer visitors,with its quaint thatched cottages,its famous Swiss Garden and the displays of historic aircraft from the nearby Shuttleworth collection.The village whose church is 800 years old was rebuilt in the 19th century as a model settlement to house the tenants of the local landowner,Lord Ongley.In the late 19th century the Old Warden Estate was bought by Joseph Shuttleworth,who renovated the village which was at that time in a poor state
